astronauts are no exception on November 1
while on a mission to
repair the space station.  International Space Station ISS two
astronauts accidentally dropped a bag of
tools Nasa said
air traffic controllers discovered the bag of tools
through surveillance cameras and they typed Gi the bag of
tools is not too necessary for the mission.  The
next missions when I saw the bag flying away I
also wondered how far it could go and
whether I could go there or not but then
I thought that if I tried any more I would only make
things worse so I did it.  Regardless,
Nasa analyzed the bag's path and
determined the risk of returning to the station at a
low level. A few days later, a
Japanese astronaut discovered the bag
while flying over the current Mount Fuji.
Now experts are still tracking
this bag.
Scientists in Norway have just
developed an Artificial Intelligence system that
can map the surface and contours
of giant icebergs from
satellite images.
Ai can complete this task
in just 1 minute, significantly faster
than manual sketching and
much more accurate than existing automated systems
according to Dr. An.  Bradman Forman,
head of the research team at uit, the
Arctic University of Norway, the new Ai system
is capable of providing
more detailed information about the shape and size of
icebergs than
current mapping services.  In the study she
used images taken by satellites of the
European space agency Esa and trained
AI algorithms to identify
icebergs even in challenging environmental conditions
according to the researchers.
Water flow, specifically the addition or subtraction of
water into the ocean when icebergs
shrink or increase, is of
great importance to the marine ecosystem. In
addition, monitoring iceberg fish will
contribute to the control of icebergs.  The dangers of
undersea transportation and production
